condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Appointment of woreda coordinator and woreda/MST finance officers, | Description :The Recipient shall appointnot later than ninety (90) days after the Effective Date: (i) Woreda Project coordinators and finance officers in WoPDs and WoFEDsto coordinate implementation, assure smooth flow of funds, monitor performance, prepare timely and quality reports; and (ii) afinance officer in MSTs all with qualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association | Due Date:01-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) for managing the Rural Livelihood Program (RLP) | Description :The Recipientshall ensure that MoU for the management of the RLP have been duly executed not later than sixty (60) days after the Effective Datebetween: (a) MoFA and (i) FCA; and (ii) EIAR; and (b) the Regional Pastoral Development Bureaus/Commission/regional president’soffice with RARIs and (ii) academic institutions as appropriate, all in form and substance satisfactory to the Association | DueDate :02-Jun-2014

Finance Agreement :Submission of first year annual work plan (including 4th quarter of FY2014) | Description :The Recipient shallfurnish to the Association for its approval the first 15 month Annual Work Plan and Budget referred to in Section I.B.2 of Schedule2 of the Financing Agreement not later than May 1, 2014 | Due Date :01-May-2014

Finance Agreement :Training of all accountants and finance officers | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that training for allaccountants and finance officers is completed within one hundred twenty (120) daysafter the Effective Date. | Due Date :01-Aug-2014

title.narrative: Clients who adopted an improved agr. technology promoted by project – female
Clients who have adopted an improved agr. technology promoted by the project
Woredas targeted by the project with woreda development plans that follow a community demand driven planning process
Sub-projects that are expected to have a mechanism for post-completion operation
Female household heads in project kebeles who report that available public services address their priority needs
CIF sub-projects completed and fully operational
Male household heads in project kebeles who report that available public services address their priority needs
Households who are members of SACCOs as a proportion of total households in target communities
People with access to a basic package of health, nutrition, or reproductive health services (number)
Sub-projects with post-project community engagement or O&M arrangements (%)
Students enrolled (grade 1-8) in PCDP constructed schools
Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Lessons from community discussions and experience sharing documented by KDCs as learning and knowledge centers
Households undertaking a viable IGA supported by a business plan
